eshmun.expression.modalities.unary

Class AXModality

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.expression.AbstractExpression
      • eshmun.expression.modalities.AbstractCTLModality
        • eshmun.expression.modalities.UnaryCTLModality
          • eshmun.expression.modalities.unary.AXModality
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Visitable

    public class AXModality
extends UnaryCTLModality
    This class represents an AX CTL Modality. (Next)

    An AX Modality has the following form AX{index}(child), where child is an AbstractExpression, and index is an optional comma separated list of process and action names.

    It means that the formula child has to hold on the next state on all the branches.

    Simplification, negation and equality is based on AX(f) = !EX(!f)

    An AX modality can be restricted to a specific process or action, AX_{i,@a}(f) indicates that f should be valid at all the next states reached by making a move by process i labeled with action a.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kinan Dak Al Bab
    See Also:
    UnaryCTLModality, EXModality, AbstractExpression

      • toNNF

        public AbstractExpression toNNF()
        Converts the current expression to NNF.

        This method is guaranteed to return an equivalent expression.

        Negative Normal Form has the negations adjacent to the variables (inside). Implications and Equivalnces are simplified into ands, ors, and nots.

        As for CTL Modalities, This method will reduce everything down to AX, EX, AU, EU.

        Specified by:
        toNNF in class AbstractExpression
        Returns:
        an expression that is the CNF equivalent of this expression.

      • clone

        public AXModality clone()
        Clones this AXModality.

        Please note that while the operator is copied, the child is not. Changes in the child could affect more than one AXModality.

        Specified by:
        clone in class AbstractExpression
        Returns:
        a shallow copy of this AXModality.

      • directCompare

        protected boolean directCompare(AbstractExpression exp)
        Equality check, this method is only called if the passed expression has the same type as this.

        The internals of the implementation of this method depends on the implementing class.

        Comparison is not done based on pointers rather than based on semantic meaning. Two Expressions are equal if they consist of the same variables (based on Name), and if these variables are connected in the same way.

        Notice that certain Operators are commutative, this doesn't change the equality of two Expression.

        Overrides:
        directCompare in class UnaryCTLModality
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to compare with this.
        Returns:
        true if this and the passed object are semantically equal (as Expressions), false otherwise.
